meanings.definition: To engage in rough or rowdy play.
meanings.sent1: The children roughhoused in the backyard, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent2: The puppies roughhoused with each other, chasing and wrestling.
meanings.sent3: The siblings roughhoused playfully, pretending to be superheroes.
meanings.sent4: The waves roughhoused against the shore, crashing with power.
meanings.sent5: The friends roughhoused at the park, enjoying their time together.

meanings.definition: To handle or treat roughly or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The wrestler roughhoused his opponent in the ring, trying to win the match.
meanings.sent2: The cat roughhoused the toy mouse, batting it around the room.
meanings.sent3: The chef roughhoused the dough, kneading it vigorously to make bread.
meanings.sent4: The wind roughhoused the leaves, swirling them around in a dance.
meanings.sent5: The bull roughhoused the gate, trying to break free from its pen.
